pr98.label: 1998 Presidential Election
pr98.desc:
Hugo Chávez elected president with 56% of the vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Pro-Chávez" defined as:
(votes for Chávez) / (valid votes cast)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet:
(votos_oficialismo) / (votos_oficialismo + votos_oposición)

rf99.label: 1999 Constitutional Referendum
rf99.desc:
Chávez's proposal to convene a constitutional convention approved with 88% of the vote; proposed powers of the convention approved with 82% of the vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Yes" defined as:
(sum of "yes" votes cast for questions one and two) / (sum of valid votes cast for questions one and two)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet:
(votos_si_pgta_1 + votos_si_pgta_2) / (votos_si_pgta_1 + votos_no_pgta_1 + votos_si_pgta_2 + votos_no_pgta_2)

pr00.label: 2000 Presidential Election
pr00.desc:
Hugo Chávez reelected with 60% of the vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Pro-Gov't" defined as:
(votes for Chávez) / (valid votes cast)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet:
(chávez) / (chávez + arias + claudio)

rg04.label: 2004 Regional Elections
rg04.desc:
Pro-Chávez candidates won governorships in 21 of 22 contested states.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Pro-Gov't" defined as:
(votes for MVR, Podemos, PPT and PCV) / (valid votes cast)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet:
(votos_oficialismo) / (votos_oficialismo + votos_oposicion)

rc04.label: 2004 Recall Referendum
rc04.desc:
Initiative to recall Chávez defeated with 59% of the vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Pro-Gov't" defined as:
(votes cast against revoking Chávez’s mandate) / (valid votes cast)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet:
rrp_no / (rrp_no + rrp_si)

pr06.label: 2006 Presidential Election
pr06.desc:
Hugo Chávez reelected with 63% of the vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Pro-Gov't" defined as:
(votes for Chávez) / (valid votes cast)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet:
(votos_oficialismo) / (votos_chávez + votos_rosales)

rf07.label: 2007 Constitutional Referendum
rf07.desc:
Chávez's proposed constitutional amendments defeated with 51% of the vote in opposition.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Yes" defined as:
(votes cast in favor of reform) / (valid votes cast)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet:
(votos_A_si + votos_A_no) / (votos_A_si + votos_A_no + votos_B_si + votos_B_no)

rg08.label: 2008 Regional Elections
rg08.desc:
Pro-Chávez candidates won 18 of 22 governorships and the mayorality of the Caracas, with approximately 55% of the national vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

Results shown are for gubernatorial elections only.

"Pro-Gov't" defined as:
(votes for Polo Patriótico candidates) / (valid votes cast)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet:
Varies by state; details available upon request.

rf09.label: 2009 Constitutional Referendum
rf09.desc:
Chávez's proposed constitutional amendments approved with 55% of the vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Yes" defined as:
("yes" votes) / (valid votes cast)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet:
(votos_si) / (votos_si + votos_no)

pm10.label: 2010 Parliamentary Elections
pm10.desc:
Pro-Chávez candidates won 98 of 165 seats in the national assembly with 49% of the vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Pro-Gov't" defined as:
(votes for PSUV candidates) / (votes for PSUV candidates + votes for MUD candidates)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet: (chavez) / (votos_validos)

Note: votes for PPT candidates dropped.

pr11.label: 2011 Primary Elections
pr11.desc: Henrique Capriles won the opposition primary with 64.2% of the 3,059,024 votes cast.

pr12.label: 2012 Presidential Election
pr12.desc:
Hugo Chávez reelected with 54% of the vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Pro-Chávez" defined as:
(votes for Chávez) / (valid votes cast)

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet: (chavez) / (votos_validos)

pr13.label: 2013 Presidential Election
pr13.desc:
Nicolás Maduro elected president with 50.78% of the vote.

Links: Wikipedia, NY Times

"Pro-Maduro" defined as:
(votes for Maduro) / (valid votes cast)

"Turnout" defined as:
(votes cast) / (counted voters (votantes escrutados))

In terms of variables in ESDATA spreadsheet: (maduro) / (votos_validos)
